content: https://github.com/rust-lang/reference/pull/874 is stuck waiting on somebody to agree that the specified case is indeed invariant. Anybody on the lang team want to give their credence to this?
We might need to ping @T-lang because i'm not sure how many of them are subscribed to this stream.
I'm subscribed but i'm behind on notifications :)
The reference does not. Just click the merge button, or if you leave an "approved" review I can click it.

I'm reviewing https://github.com/rust-lang/nomicon/pull/259 and I'd appreciate it if someone from the T-lang could also review it since it's a major change. This adds a step-by-step example to the "Send and Sync" chapter

(Not a lang team member) A cursory look at the two examples don't show anything wrong to me. It looks more like a step b step example for making a Box-like moreso with Send and Sync being incidental than an actual step-by-step guide for Send and Sync.
thanks for checking! yeah, but I think it's the best place to put this example except for creating a new chapter

Another one: https://github.com/rust-lang/nomicon/pull/223
The implementation looks good to me but I'm afraid that I cannot have time to read more carefully so it'd be great if someone could also check it, thanks :)
I don't think review on that one would be limited to lang folks; you might actually want to get a library person to look at that.
I don't think I have nomicon in my lang-team triage script
Could someone take a look at rust-lang/reference#841? The explanation seems to match the behavior but I'm not sure if it's entirely correct or we should document in more detail
The explanation does seem to match the behavior. I find myself wondering what happens if you try to use a generic type in the static...

Ah, just got the answer:

error[E0401]: can't use generic parameters from outer function
